newsitem.title: USA: CA, Cheyenne call motion without merit.
newsitem.headline: CA, Cheyenne call motion without merit.

text.p: Computer Associates International Inc and Cheyenne Software Inc said on Monday they consider a motion to preliminarily enjoin the completion of CA's tender to buy Cheyenne as without merit.
The companies said in a joint statement that they deny any wrongdoing and will defend the action vigorously.
A hearing is set for November 6 in Delaware Chancery Court to consider a motion related to an amendment to a class action complaint originally filed against Cheyenne in April, 1996.

The motion alleges, among other things, that Cheyenne's directors breached their fiduciary duties by rejecting an earlier offer from McAfee Associates Inc to negotiate a merger of Cheyenne and McAfee and by agreeing to the proposed transaction with CA.
The amended complaint also names CA as a party to the litigation, the companies said.
The companies said the tender offer is scheduled to expire on November 8, 1996.
